conclusion: To determine if the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark, analyze the v-t graph and calculate displacement.
The y-axis represents velocity in m/s and the x-axis represents time in seconds.
The area under the velocity-time graph gives the displacement.
From t = 0 to t = 1 s, the velocity is constant at 2 m/s. The area is 2 meters.
From t = 1 to t = 2 s, the velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s. The area is 1 meter.
From t = 2 to t = 3 s, the velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s. The area is -1 meter.
The total displacement is 2 meters, so the particle has not returned to its starting point.
Final Answer: No, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
